event.title: was selected as Malheur's county seat in 1955

data.event: Vale was selected as Malheur's county seat in 1955, 68 years after the county was founded.

event.title: 68 years after the county was founded

data.event: Vale was selected as Malheur's county seat in 1955, 68 years after the county was founded.
A post office with the name of Vale was established in February 1883, and the community was incorporated by the Oregon Legislative Assembly on February 21, 1889.

event.title: was incorporated by the Oregon Legislative Assembly on February 21, 1889

data.event: A post office with the name of Vale was established in February 1883, and the community was incorporated by the Oregon Legislative Assembly on February 21, 1889.

event.title: became the City of Vale in 1905

data.event: Originally incorporated as the Town of Vale, it became the City of Vale in 1905.

Typically there will be 148.3 nights each winter falling below 32 °F or 0 °C and 6.3 nights falling under 0 °F or −17.8 °C, although the clear skies mean that only 25.2 days do not top freezing and only 101.5 days fail to top 50 °F or 10 °C. During summer, 12.7 days will top 100 °F or 37.8 °C and 61.2 days – including 43 of 62 in July and August – will on average top 90 °F or 32.2 °C. However, the low humidity and clear high-altitude skies mean nights are cool even in summer, with minima rarely above 65 °F or 18.3 °C.
